$schema.title: /$schema
$schema.description: The URI that specifies the schema that describes this type of file

archive-manager.description: Settings related to opening archive files
archive-manager.title: /tuning/archive-manager

min-free-space.title: /tuning/archive-manager/min-free-space
min-free-space.description: The minimum free space, in bytes, to maintain when unpacking archives

cache-ttl.title: /tuning/archive-manager/cache-ttl
cache-ttl.description: The time-to-live for unpacked archives, expressed as a duration (e.g. '3d' for three days)

piper.description: Settings related to capturing piped data
piper.title: /tuning/piper

max-size.title: /tuning/piper/max-size
max-size.description: The maximum size of a capture file

rotations.title: /tuning/piper/rotations
rotations.description: The number of rotated files to keep

ttl.title: /tuning/piper/ttl
ttl.description: The time-to-live for captured data, expressed as a duration (e.g. '3d' for three days)

file-vtab.description: Settings related to the lnav_file virtual-table
file-vtab.title: /tuning/file-vtab

max-content-size.title: /tuning/file-vtab/max-content-size
max-content-size.description: The maximum allowed file size for the content column

max-unrecognized-lines.title: /tuning/logfile/max-unrecognized-lines
max-unrecognized-lines.description: The maximum number of lines in a file to use when detecting the format

remote.description: Settings related to remote file support
remote.title: /tuning/remote

cache-ttl.title: /tuning/remote/cache-ttl
cache-ttl.description: The time-to-live for files copied from remote hosts, expressed as a duration (e.g. '3d' for three days)

ssh.description: Settings related to the ssh command used to contact remote machines
ssh.title: /tuning/remote/ssh

transfer-command.title: /tuning/remote/ssh/transfer-command
transfer-command.description: Command executed on the remote host when transferring the file

start-command.title: /tuning/remote/ssh/start-command
start-command.description: Command executed on the remote host to start the tailer

flags.title: /tuning/remote/ssh/flags
flags.description: The flags to pass to the SSH command

options.description: The options to pass to the SSH command
options.title: /tuning/remote/ssh/options

^(\\w+)$.title: /tuning/remote/ssh/options/<option_name>
^(\\w+)$.description: Set an option to be passed to the SSH command

config.description: The ssh_config options to pass to SSH with the -o option
config.title: /tuning/remote/ssh/config

general.description: Commands to work with the general clipboard
general.title: /tuning/clipboard/impls/<clipboard_impl_name>/general

find.description: Commands to work with the find clipboard
find.title: /tuning/clipboard/impls/<clipboard_impl_name>/find

url-scheme.description: Settings related to custom URL handling
url-scheme.title: /tuning/url-scheme

^([a-z][\\w\\-\\+\\.]+)$.description: Definition of a custom URL scheme
^([a-z][\\w\\-\\+\\.]+)$.title: /tuning/url-scheme/<url_scheme>

handler.title: /tuning/url-scheme/<url_scheme>/handler
handler.description: The name of the lnav script that can handle URLs with of this scheme.  This should not include the '.lnav' suffix.

clock-format.title: /ui/clock-format
clock-format.description: The format for the clock displayed in the top-left corner using strftime(3) conversions

dim-text.title: /ui/dim-text
dim-text.description: Reduce the brightness of text (useful for xterms). This setting can be useful when running in an xterm where the white color is very bright.

default-colors.title: /ui/default-colors
default-colors.description: Use default terminal background and foreground colors instead of black and white for all text coloring.  This setting can be useful when transparent background or alternate color theme terminal is used.

keymap.title: /ui/keymap
keymap.description: The name of the keymap to use.

theme.description: The name of the theme to use.

vars.description: Variables definitions that are used in this theme.

movement.description: Log file cursor movement mode settings

mode.title: /ui/movement/mode
mode.description: The mode of cursor movement to use.

^((?:x[0-9a-f]{2})+)$.description: Map of key codes to commands to execute.  The field names are the keys to be mapped using as a hexadecimal representation of the UTF-8 encoding.  Each byte of the UTF-8 should start with an 'x' followed by the hexadecimal representation of the byte.
^((?:x[0-9a-f]{2})+)$.title: /ui/keymap-defs/<keymap_name>/<key_seq>

id.title: /ui/keymap-defs/<keymap_name>/<key_seq>/id
id.description: The identifier that can be used to refer to this key

command.title: /ui/keymap-defs/<keymap_name>/<key_seq>/command
command.description: The command to execute for the given key sequence.  Use a script to execute more complicated operations.

alt-msg.title: /ui/keymap-defs/<keymap_name>/<key_seq>/alt-msg
alt-msg.description: The help message to display after the key is pressed.

date-time.description: Settings related to log message dates and times
date-time.title: /log/date-time

expr.title: /log/watch-expressions/<watch_name>/expr
expr.description: The SQL expression to execute for each input line. If expression evaluates to true, a 'log message detected' event will be published.

enabled.title: /log/watch-expressions/<watch_name>/enabled
enabled.description: Indicates whether or not this expression should be evaluated during log processing.

condition.title: /log/annotations/<annotation_name>/condition
condition.description: The SQLite expression to execute for a log message that determines whether or not this annotation is applicable.  The expression is evaluated the same way as a filter expression

handler.title: /log/annotations/<annotation_name>/handler
handler.description: The script to execute to generate the annotation content. A JSON object with the log message content will be sent to the script on the standard input

pattern.title: /log/demux/<name>/pattern
pattern.description: A regular expression to match a line in a multiplexed file

^(\\w+)$.title: /global/<var_name>
^(\\w+)$.description: A global variable definition.  Global variables can be referenced in scripts, SQL statements, or commands.

clip-commands.title: clip-commands
clip-commands.description: Container for the commands used to read from and write to the system clipboard

write.title: /write
write.description: The command used to write to the clipboard

read.title: /read
read.description: The command used to read from the clipboard

color.title: /color
color.description: The foreground color value for this style. The value can be the name of an xterm color, the hexadecimal value, or a theme variable reference.

background-color.title: /background-color
background-color.description: The background color value for this style. The value can be the name of an xterm color, the hexadecimal value, or a theme variable reference.

underline.title: /underline
underline.description: Indicates that the text should be underlined.

bold.title: /bold
bold.description: Indicates that the text should be bolded.
